articles.headline: Buying an Electric Vehicle? Here Is Some Advice.
articles.snippet: Buying an electric car can be exciting and bewildering. Consider what kind of car you want and need and where you will charge.
articles.abstract: Buying an electric car can be exciting and bewildering. Consider what kind of car you want and need and where you will charge.
articles.lead_paragraph: The allure of the electric vehicle has never been stronger.

articles.headline: Years of Unheeded Warnings. Then the Subway Crash Mexico City Had Feared.
articles.snippet: Mexico City’s subway system has been plagued with problems for years. On Monday, an overpass collapsed, and a train plunged some 50 feet, killing at least 24 people and setting off a political firestorm.
articles.abstract: Mexico City’s subway system has been plagued with problems for years. On Monday, an overpass collapsed, and a train plunged some 50 feet, killing at least 24 people and setting off a political firestorm.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — The capital had been bracing for the disaster for years.
articles.byline: By Maria Abi-Habib, Oscar Lopez, Natalie Kitroeff and Mike Ives

articles.headline: What the Gates Divorce Means for the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation
articles.snippet: The end of one marriage has implications for the 1,600 staff members who direct $5 billion in annual grants to 135 countries.
articles.abstract: The end of one marriage has implications for the 1,600 staff members who direct $5 billion in annual grants to 135 countries.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation started with ambitions that, by its lofty standards today, appear almost quaint: providing free internet access to public libraries in the United States. As its founders’ objectives grew in scope, so did the foundation’s reach, until it achieved its current position as the pre-eminent private institution in global public health.

articles.headline: Biden Shifts Vaccination Strategy in Drive to Reopen by July 4
articles.snippet: President Biden, facing a slowing rate of vaccinations and a hope for near normalcy by Independence Day, said the government would shift from mass vaccination sites to local settings.
articles.abstract: President Biden, facing a slowing rate of vaccinations and a hope for near normalcy by Independence Day, said the government would shift from mass vaccination sites to local settings.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden, confronting lagging vaccinations that threaten his promise of near normalcy by July 4, on Tuesday overhauled the strategy to battle the pandemic, shifting from mass vaccination sites to more local settings to target younger Americans and those hesitant to get a shot.
articles.byline: By Sharon LaFraniere and Noah Weiland

articles.headline: The U.S. Birthrate Has Dropped Again. The Pandemic May Be Accelerating the Decline.
articles.snippet: Over all, the birthrate declined by 4 percent in 2020. Births were down most sharply in December, when babies conceived at the start of the health crisis would have been born.
articles.abstract: Over all, the birthrate declined by 4 percent in 2020. Births were down most sharply in December, when babies conceived at the start of the health crisis would have been born.
articles.lead_paragraph: The birthrate declined for the sixth straight year in 2020, the federal government reported on Wednesday, early evidence that the coronavirus pandemic accelerated a trend among American women of delaying pregnancy.

articles.headline: As Covid Ravages Poorer Countries, Rich Nations Spring Back to Life
articles.snippet: Despite early vows, the developed world has done little to promote global vaccination, in what analysts call both a moral and epidemiological failure.
articles.abstract: Despite early vows, the developed world has done little to promote global vaccination, in what analysts call both a moral and epidemiological failure.
articles.lead_paragraph: The contrast could hardly be sharper.

articles.headline: ‘I Used to Like School’: An 11-Year-Old’s Struggle With Pandemic Learning
articles.snippet: Without home internet, Jordyn Coleman has had trouble staying connected to remote classes during the coronavirus pandemic.
articles.abstract: Without home internet, Jordyn Coleman has had trouble staying connected to remote classes during the coronavirus pandemic.
articles.lead_paragraph: CLARKSDALE, Miss. — By the time Precious Coleman returned home from her overnight shift at a casino, it was past 9 in the morning. It had been another night of dealing with belligerent patrons who refused to wear their face masks and drunks who needed to be escorted to the curb. Her eyes stung.
articles.byline: By Rukmini Callimachi and Tamir Kalifa

articles.headline: Facebook Oversight Board Upholds Social Network’s Ban of Trump
articles.snippet: A company-appointed panel ruled that the ban was justified at the time but added that the company should reassess its action and make a final decision in six months.
articles.abstract: A company-appointed panel ruled that the ban was justified at the time but added that the company should reassess its action and make a final decision in six months.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A Facebook-appointed panel of journalists, activists and lawyers on Wednesday upheld the social network’s ban of former President Donald J. Trump, ending any immediate return by Mr. Trump to mainstream social media and renewing a debate about tech power over online speech.
